description: The function 'create_categorical_graph' generates educational stimulus images in the form of bar graphs, histograms, or picture graphs. These visualizations are designed to represent categorical data, aiding in the understanding of frequency distribution, data comparison, and data interpretation.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Categorical Graphs
stimulus_type_specification.description: The 'create_categorical_graph' function can draw three types of visualizations: bar graphs, histograms, and picture graphs. It accepts input in the form of a 'CategoricalGraphList', which includes information about the graph type, title, x and y axis labels, and data points. Each data point consists of a category and a frequency. For picture graphs, additional configuration parameters such as star value, star unit, and whether to show half star values can be provided. The function validates the frequency values to ensure they are non-negative and either whole numbers or half values. These visualizations serve the educational purpose of teaching students about data representation and interpretation, frequency distribution, and comparison of different categories.

details: graph_type: Determines the type of graph to be drawn (bar graph, histogram, or picture graph)
title: The title of the graph
x_axis_label: The label for the x-axis
y_axis_label: The label for the y-axis
data: A list of data points, each consisting of a category and a frequency
star_value: (Optional for picture graphs) The value that each star represents
star_unit: (Optional for picture graphs) The unit for what each star represents
show_half_star_value: (Optional for picture graphs) Whether to show an additional legend for half star values
Frequency values must be either whole numbers or half values
For picture graphs, star value must be greater than 0
Draws bar graphs, histograms, or picture graphs based on the input parameters
The x-axis represents categories and the y-axis represents frequencies
For picture graphs, stars are used to represent frequencies, with the option to display half star values

educational_standards.description: Interpret data with up to three categories.
Ask and answer questions about the number of data points in each category.
Ask and answer questions about how many more data points are in one category than in another.
Ask and answer questions about how many less data points are in one category than in another.
Draw a bar graph with a single-unit scale to represent a data set with up to four categories.
Solve simple put-together problems using information presented in a single-unit scaled bar graph.
Solve simple take-apart problems using information presented in a single-unit scaled bar graph.
Solve simple compare problems using information presented in a single-unit scaled bar graph.
Draw a scaled picture graph to represent a data set with several categories.
Draw a scaled bar graph to represent a data set with several categories
Solve problems on scaled bar graphs.

educational_standards.display_name: Analyze Bar Graphs: Two Step Problems
educational_standards.description: Solve two-step additive-comparison problems that require combining or comparing results from categorical data represented in a pictograph, or bar graph with scaled intervals.
Identify samples that are representative, random or biased.
Recognize that a measure of center for a numerical data set summarizes all of its values with a single number.
Interpret and analyze data presented in tables, charts, and graphs to solve problems involving measures of center, frequency, and percentages.
Report the number of observations of data from a math problem.

educational_standards.display_name: Finding Quantitative Measures from Charts and Graphs
educational_standards.description: Interpret charts and graphs to find mean, median, mode, and range.
